text: The East Lancs Vyking is a double-decker body of a bus, It has a low-floor, It was built from 2000 to 2006 by East Lancashire Coachbuilders. The body could be built on the Volvo B7L chassis and the Volvo B7TL chassis. East Lancs misspelled bus names on purpose (naming it "Vyking" instead of "Viking") ==Myllennium Vyking== In 2001, East Lancashire Coachbuilders made a improved model of the Vyking body called Myllennium Vyking, It was built from 2001 to 2006. It was was built on Volvo B7TL chassis only. == Gallery == File:20171007 Connexions SP51AWW.jpg|Connexions East Lancs Vyking in October 2017 File:Wilts & Dorset 405.jpg|Wilts & Dorset East Lancs Vyking Myllennium in Boscombe in May 2006 File:Au Morandarte Flickr DSC00370 (10232883576).jpg|London United East Lancs Vyking Myllennium in 2006 File:Volvo B7L Myllennium Vyking.jpg|Rear end view of an open-top Myllennium Vyking in Luxembourg, showing the different rear-end layout of the Volvo B7L chassis used in Europe. File:Bluestar 781 HX51 ZRC rear.JPG|Rear end view of a Myllennium Vyking in England, showing the different rear-end layout of the Volvo B7L chassis used in the United Kingdom. File:Wilts & Dorset 404 HF54 KXW rear 2.JPG|Rear end view of a Myllennium Vyking in England, showing the different rear-end layout of the Volvo B7L chassis used in the United Kingdom. ==Related pages== *For the single decker, see East Lancs Myllennium * For the double-deck body on Dennis Trident 2 chassis, see East Lancs Myllennium Lolyne * For the double-deck body on DAF DB250 chassis, see East Lancs Myllennium Lowlander * For the double-deck body on Volvo B9TL, see East Lancs Myllennium Nordic ==References== ==Other websites== * * Vyking Category:Double-decker buses
title: East Lancs Vyking
